intro: Aneilema protensum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, blue, and white, are often used in ornamental horticulture. Aneilema protensum thrives in humid, well-drained soils and prefers partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation.
